title: Analytics Tools Guide
description: Product documentation and self-help for Analysis Workspace, Adobe Analytics dashboards, Activity Map, Report Builder, Reporting API, and Reports & Analytics.

title: What is Analysis Workspace and how do I use it?
description: Analysis Workspace is the premier analysis tool for Adobe Analytics. It lets you use panels, tables, visualizations, and other components to bring data to life, curate a dataset, share and schedule projects, among other capabilities.

title: What's New in Analysis Workspace
description: New features in Analysis Workspace.

title: Projects overview
description: Learn the basics of working in a Workspace project.

title: Save projects
description: Learn about the different save options, including autosave, save as, and save as template.

title: Templates
description: Create workspace projects based on standard or custom templates.

title: Multiple report suites
description: Learn how and why to create projects in Workspace with multiple report suites

title: Hotkeys (shortcuts)
description: Keyboard interactions, shortcut keys and point-and-click behaviors available in Analysis Workspace.

title: What are Visualization Color Palettes and How do they Work?
description: How to use the visualization color palette in Analysis Workspace

title: View Density
description: Learn how to adjust the view density.

title: Components overview
description: Components in Analysis Workspace consist of dimensions, metrics, segments, and date ranges that you can drag-and-drop onto a project.

title: Preview dimensions
description: View the top values of a dimension before using it in a project.

title: Break down dimensions
description: Break down dimensions and dimension items in Analysis Workspace.

title: Time-parting dimensions
description: Time parting takes the timestamp of collected hits and breaks it into more meaningful dimensions, such as "Hour of Day" or "Day of Week".

title: Metrics
description: There are two ways to use metrics in Analysis Workspace.

title: Segments
description: Use segments in Analysis Workspace.

title: Calendar and date ranges overview
description: In the calendar, you can specify dates and date ranges, or select a preset.

title: Create custom date ranges
description: Create custom date ranges in Analysis Workspace, and save them as Time components.

title: Date comparison
description: Date Comparison in Analysis Workspace lets you take any column containing a date range and create a common date comparison, such as  year-over-year, quarter-over-quarter, month-over-month, etc.

title: Visualizations overview
description: Visually represent your data with visualizations.

title: Manage data sources
description: Synchronizing visualizations lets you control which data table or data source corresponds to a visualization.

title: Freeform table
description: Freeform tables are the foundation for data analysis in Workspace

title: Column settings
description: Column settings let you configure column formatting, some of which can be conditional.

title: Row settings
description: Row settings vary depending on which component you have dragged into the table.

title: Dynamic vs static dimension items in freeform tables
description: How to interact with dynamic and static dimension items in tables.

title: Pagination, filtering and sorting tables
description: Video discussing pagination, filtering and sorting.

title: Workspace totals
description: How Workspace totals are calculated.

title: What is Cohort Analysis and how does it work?
description: Dig deeper into the data around your audience and break into related groups with Cohort Analysis. Learn about cohort analysis in Analysis Workspace.

title: Run a cohort analysis report
description: Create a cohort and run a cohort analysis report in Analysis Workspace.

title: Cohort analysis use cases
description: Use case examples for cohort analysis.

title: Fallout overview
description: Use the fallout visualization in a Workspace project.

title: Configure a fallout visualization
description: Configure a fallout visualization.

title: Inter-dimensional fallout
description: Fallout in Analysis Workspace lets you to mix and match dimensions and metrics as touchpoints in funnels and workflows. This gives you more flexibility in defining the user steps you want to investigate.

title: Apply segments in fallout analysis
description: You can create segments from a touchpoint, add segments as touchpoint, and compare key workflows across various segments in Analysis Workspace.

title: Flow overview
description: Use the flow visualization in a Workspace project.

title: Configure a flow visualization
description: Use the flow visualization in a Workspace project.

title: Flow settings
description: Use the flow visualization in a Workspace project.

title: Inter-dimensional flows
description: An inter-dimensional flow lets you examine user paths across various dimensions.

title: Histogram
description: A histogram is a new visualization type in Analysis Workspace.

title: Map
description: Use the map visualization in a Workspace project.

title: Venn
description: The Venn visualization lets you drag in up to 3 segments (from Components) and one metric to build a Venn diagram.

title: Area and area stacked
description: This Workspace visualization is like a line graph, but with a colored area below the line.

title: Bar and bar stacked
description: Use the bar visualization in a Workspace project.

title: Bullet graph
description: Lets you see how a value you are interested in compares to or measures against other performance ranges (goals).

title: Donut
description: Use the donut visualization in a Workspace project.

title: Horizontal Bar and Horizontal Bar Stacked
description: Use the horizontal bar visualization in a Workspace project.

title: Line
description: Use the line visualization to depict trended (time-based) data sets

title: Scatterplot
description: A visualization that shows the relationship between up to three metrics.

title: Summary Number and Summary Change
description: Use the Summary Number and Change visualizations to display important data points in a project.

title: Text
description: Lets you add user-defined text to your Workspace.

title: Treemap
description: Displays hierarchical (tree-structured) data as a set of nested rectangles.

title: Panels overview
description: A panel is a collection of tables and visualizations

title: Analytics for Target (A4T) panel
description: Analytics for Target (A4T) panel lets you analyze your Adobe Target activities and experiences in Analysis Workspace.

title: Attribution panel
description: How to use and interpret the attribution panel in Analysis Workspace.

title: Blank panel
description: Create a blank panel as a starting point for any visualization.

title: Freeform panel
description: Learn about freeform panels

title: Media Concurrent Viewers panel
description: How to use and interpret the Media Concurrent Viewers panel in Analysis Workspace.

title: Quick Insights panel
description: Quick Insights is a tool for new Workspace users that guides them in building data tables and visualizations

title: Segment comparison panel overview
description: Learn how to use the segment comparison panel, part of Segment IQ in Analysis Workspace.

title: Segment comparison use cases
description: Learn real-world use cases on how the segment comparison panel can be used to gain insight into marketing strategy.

title: Statistical tests used in segment comparison
description: Each of the top comparison tables show a difference score that is calculated by several statistical tests depending on the comparison being made;however, no matter which test is used, the difference score is shown as a value between 0 and 1.

title: Share menu
description: You can curate, share and schedule PDF/CSV projects to recipients in your organiziation.

title: Curate projects
description: Curation lets you limit components before sharing a project.

title: Share projects
description: Project sharing and project roles in Workspace

title: Create shareable links
description: Learn how to create shareable links to projects or visualizations

title: View-only projects
description: View-only projects in Workspace

title: Download PDF or CSV files
description: You can download data from Analysis Workspace by copying it, or in PDF and CSV formats.

title: Schedule projects
description: Send an Analysis Workspace project via email or schedule it for delivery.

title: Attribution overview
description: The concept of attributing credit of a success event to multiple dimension items.

title: Attribution models and lookback windows
description: How different types of attribution divide credit between dimension items.

title: Algorithmic attribution
description: Details on the algorithmic attribution model.

title: Attribution FAQ
description: Get answers to commonly asked questions around attribution.

title: Journey IQ
description: Understand the features that make up Journey IQ, a set of features that are a part of Adobe Analytics.

title: Segment IQ Overview
description: Learn about what Adobe Analytics Segment IQ is and how it can help your organization.

title: Virtual Analyst
description: Learn what features in Adobe Analytics contribute to the Virtual Analyst.

title: Anomaly Detection overview
description: You can view and analyze data anomalies contextually, within Analysis Workspace.

title: View anomalies in Analysis Workspace
description: You can view anomalies in a table or in a line chart.

title: Turn off anomaly detection
description: Turn off Anomaly detection on any metric.

title: Statistical techniques used in anomaly detection
description: Data inconsistencies can cause big problems. Learn how to identify statistical anomalies with anomaly detection techniques from Adobe. Get started today.

title: Contribution Analysis overview
description: Use Contribution Analysis to identify statistical anomalies and correlations in data.

title: Run Contribution Analysis
description: Run a Contribution Analysis report in a Workspace project.

title: Statistical techniques used in Contribution Analysis
description: Contribution Analysis is an intensive machine learning process designed to uncover contributors to an observed anomaly in Adobe Analytics. The intent is to assist the user in finding areas of focus or opportunities for additional analysis much more quickly than would otherwise be possible.

title: Intelligent Alerts overview
description: The new Intelligent Alerts system allows for more granular control over alerts and integrates anomaly detection with the alert system.

title: Alert Builder
description: Get alerts when project components reach certain thresholds.

title: Alert Manager
description: Create, edit, or delete alerts.

title: Intelligent Alerts - use cases
description: Use cases for intelligent alerts.

title: How to set user preferences in Analysis Workspace
Frequently asked questions and troubleshooting Workspace
description: Workspace FAQs

title: Analysis Workspace performance factors and optimization
description: Factors that will impact Workspace performance and optimizations you can make

title: Common error messages in Analysis Workspace
description: List of error messages in Adobe Analysis Workspace and its related components

title: Known limitations in Analysis Workspace
description: List of known limitations in Adobe Analysis Workspace and its related components

title: Administration requirements
description: System requirements for Analysis Workspace.

title: Accessibility in Analysis Workspace
description: Accessibility support features in Analysis Workspace

title: Report Builder for Adobe Analytics
description: Use Report Builder to bring Adobe Analytics data directly into Microsoft Excel. Find out how installing and using Report Builder can boost your business.

title: System requirements
description: System recommendations and prerequisites.

title: Install Report Builder
description: Steps that describe how to install Report Builder.

title: Upgrade Report Builder
description: Steps for and considerations regarding upgrading Report Builder.

title: How to Sign In to Report Builder
description: Learn how to sign in to Report Builder using your Experience Cloud login account.

title: Uninstall Report Builder
description: Steps that describe how to uninstall Adobe Report Builder.

title: Invoke Report Builder functionality from Microsoft Excel functions
description: This ability further integrates Report Builder usage within the natural Excel workflow, without requiring you to access the Report Builder user interface.

title: Report Builder toolbar
description: Information to help you understand the function of the buttons on the Report Builder toolbar.

title: Data requests - Request Wizard Step 1
description: The first step when creating a request in Report Builder.

title: Create a data request
description: Steps to create a basic Report Builder data request.

title: Select a report suite
description: Steps to help you select a report suite in Excel.

title: Select a report suite from an existing request in Excel
description: Steps to help you select a report suite from the existing request.

title: Use Excel to locate a report suite ID
description: If you do not know a report suite's ID, you can drag and drop the value in the Report Suite field in the Report Suite menu to a cell in your Excel workbook.

title: Manage segments
description: How to add, edit, apply, and filter Adobe Analytics segments in Report Builder.

title: Allow Publishing List Overrides
description: When you schedule a report, you can choose a publishing list to use for distribution.

title: Report types overview
description: You can select the base report type for your data request, such as Site Metrics, Site Content, and Video.

title: Path and path fallout reports in Report Builder
description: Describes how report builder supports pathing and fallout reports and how the implementation differs from Reports & Analytics.

title: Filter a Path Report Using the Request Wizard
description: Describes the steps involved in applying filters to a pathing report.

title: Filter a Fallout Report Using the Request Wizard
description: Describes the steps involved in applying filters to a fallout report.

title: Filter Path Reports by Adding Dependent Requests
description: Describes how to create path reports with predefined filters.

title: Select a report type
description: Steps to select the base report type for your data request.

title: Import bookmarked reports and dashboard reportlets
description: All bookmarked reports and dashboard reports are now listed as dimensions in the Request Wizard Step 1 and can be imported as report builder requests.

title: Request Wizard definitions - preset dates
description: Preset dates let you select commonly used dates or dates you have saved. On the Request Wizard  Step 1, choose Preset Dates. Here are the field definitions for preset dates in Report Builder.

title: Fixed dates and saved date ranges
description: When you specify a fixed date or date range, report builder displays the reporting calendar, which lets you select a date, a date range, or a preset date. You can also save a fixed date to use as a template, and specify whether the saved dates are available for the current report suite or for all report suites.

title: Request Wizard definitions - fixed dates
description: Definitions for fixed dates in report builder.

title: Rolling dates
description: Steps that describe how to customize a rolling date for your request.

title: Request Wizard definitions - rolling dates
description: Field definitions for rolling dates in report builder.

title: Real-time reports
description: Displays web page traffic and ranks page views in real time, so that you can more quickly understand what is trending on your site.

title: Configure a real-time request
description: Steps that describe how to configure real-time request dates.

title: Customized date expressions - overview
description: You can specify a complex date range by building a custom expression.

title: Date abbreviations
description: Time abbreviations refer to a particular date when a period begins, not a range of days. A range of days is expressed by specifying a start and an end date for two time abbreviations (or terms).

title: Individual starting or ending dates
description: Abbreviations for starting and ending dates.

title: Examples of date ranges using customized expressions
description: Examples, notes, and syntax notes about using date ranges in customized expressions.

title: Customized Date Considerations
description: Two important considerations when using the Customize Expression to set the date range

title: Dates from a cell
description: You can specify a date range by selecting cells from a worksheet that contains a request. Report builder uses the specific date range information in those requests. If you select today's date, you see partial data based on the time of day the request runs.

title: Granularity
description: On the Request Wizard  Step 1, you can apply a level of granularity to the data request. Granularity specifies the level of time-based detail that is included in the report.

title: Custom calendar
description: Report builder uses the Analytics custom calendar. You can use the calendar to define the first day of the week and year, or use a different retail calendar style. The calendar formats are used to for various purposes, including sales comparison and forecast standardization, payroll cost analysis, or physical inventory count regulation.

title: Interactive controls
description: Interactive Controls allow you to edit segments and date ranges for one or more requests directly from the worksheet. This gives you more flexibility when updating report builder requests.

title: Layout - Request Wizard Step 2
description: The Request Wizard  Step 2 window lets you configure the report layout, header formatting, and dimension filtering for output. You can use a Pivot Layout to configure the request, which is similar how you create an Excel pivot table.

title: Metrics and dimensions overview
description: You can add metrics and dimensions to the Request Wizard  Step 2 to define the Analytics layout of the data in your request. The list of metrics and dimensions in Report Builder follow the menu layout displayed in Reports and Analytics.

title: Add metrics and dimensions
description: Steps to add metrics and dimensions to a request.

title: Calculated Metrics
description: Report Builder 5.2 supports Adobe Analytics Unified Calculated Metrics. Among other innovations, all calculated metrics now have a global ID - they are no longer restricted to one report suite.

title: Combine traffic and commerce metrics in the same request
description: You can now combine these two metric types in one and the same request, instead of having to create separate requests.

title: User access permissions for dimensions and metrics
description: Adobe Report Builder now features permissioning settings analogous to those in the Analytics Admin Tools.

title: Modify metrics - field definitions
description: Field descriptions for configuring metrics in Report Builder.

title: Customer attributes
description: Customer attributes are stored in new type of element called VisAttr, which can be configured as a dimension or a metric.

title: Anomaly Detection
description: Anomaly detection uses statistical modeling to automatically find unexpected trends in your data. The model analyzes metrics and determines a lower bound, upper bound, and expected range of values. When an unexpected spike or drop occurs, the system alerts you in the report.

title: Configure an anomaly detection request
description: Steps that describe how to create an anomaly detection request in report builder.

title: Format the date
description: In addition to the standard cell formatting choices available through Excel's Format > Cells (Ctrl+1) feature, you can apply limited formatting to cell ranges with report builder. These formatting choices depend on the metric you have chosen.

title: Format display headers
description: You can name your report and configure how to display row and column headers. The Format Options link is available for the Pivot and Custom Layout types.

title: Hide or show headers
description: This procedure describes how to hide or show headers.

title: Delete output mapping
description: If you are editing your workbook and want to make room for new requests, you might need to delete requests.

title: Name a request
description: You can specify a custom name for your request, which displays in the Request Manager.

title: Prepend and postpend text to cells
description: In Pivot and Custom Layout requests, for numeric or string values, you can prepend or postpend strings or characters to cells.

title: Configure the custom layout
description: The Custom Layout provides most of the functionality of the Pivot Layout, but lets you choose where each item in the grid should be located in the spreadsheet. This layout provides the flexibility available in previous releases, including adding breakdowns and microcharts.

title: Map metrics and dimensions to cells
description: Before you begin to map items to the spreadsheet, ensure that your spreadsheet is not protected. If the protection scheme for your worksheet prevents any user actions, you will not be able to select cells in the spreadsheet. First, unprotect the sheet and then add cell mappings.

title: Create a microchart
description: In the Custom Layout, you can turn a metric column into a bar chart with a corresponding percentage value, or a percentage value with a corresponding bar chart. The percentage value is the metric value or total for the overall non-filtered request for the period.

title: Filter dimensions overview
description: You can filter on dimensions that you add to the Row Labels grid. Filters narrow the data returned by requests and can be applied from the Pivot or Custom Layouts. When you configure dimension filtering from the Pivot Layout, you can additionally specify the number of entries from cell.

title: Most popular filtering
description: Ranking and conditional filters that you configure using Boolean logic with AND/OR search expressions.

title: Specific filters
description: Filters that apply specific dimension terms.

title: Saved filters
description: You can save filters or other parameters in report builder and use them in other worksheets or workbooks. These parameters are saved to Analytics, to ensure that they are available to other report builder users on other computers.

title: Manage requests - definitions
description: Field descriptions for Manage Requests in Report Builder.

title: Diagnostic messages
description: Diagnostic messages provide you information about the status of the request when you refresh it.

title: Sort ascending or descending
description: You can sort the requests listed in the Request Manager in ascending or descending order.

title: Protected worksheet elements
description: If you protect your worksheet (by locking cells), you cannot create, edit, or refresh requests. Remove all protection from your worksheet before using Request Manager.

title: Edit multiple requests
description: You can change several requests at the same time, based on the request's report suite, granularity, and date range.

title: Edit metrics across multiple requests
description: The Edit Metrics Across Multiple Requests feature lets you easily add, remove, or replace metrics in a pre-existing request or across a group of requests.

title: Refresh a request
description: You refresh requests after you update them with edits, filters, or you need to view more recent data. You can select several requests in a worksheet and refresh them all at once.

title: Refresh requests for all sheets
description: You can refresh requests for all sheets or for multiple requests.

title: Add dependent requests
description: A dependent request is a request that is dependent upon an existing request.

title: Classification
description: Classification breakdowns are used to map analytics reporting data to related properties. Classifications can be used for a variety of purposes but are most commonly used for classifying campaign tracking codes (both internal and external) and product IDs.

title: Copy requests overview
description: You can copy cells mapped with more than one request and paste the content to an empty, selected region of the spreadsheet.

title: Copy simple requests
description: Copy a simple request rather than a referential request. A simple request is one that contains no references to another request or the contents of a cell.

title: Copy adjacent requests
description: In the same way that you copy and paste requests, you can also relocate requests to another part of the spreadsheet by selecting Cut Request from the shortcut menu.

title: Copy worksheets
description: Copy one spreadsheet to another in the same workbook.

title: Copy requests and worksheets between workbooks
description: Copy an entire spreadsheet in a source workbook to a spreadsheet in one or more target workbooks.

title: Create more than one copy of a request
description: You can create more than one copy of an original request by filling a selected area of cells with as many copies of the request that will fit.

title: Copy referential requests
description: A referential request uses values from cells as input for parameters, such as a data filter or relational filter.

title: Save a workbook with requests
description: After creating reports with embedded requests, you can save them by clicking File > Save or File > Save As in Excel. Report builder detects whether the report contains requests. When you click on either of these save options, the Save Workbook As form is displayed.

title: Specify conditional formatting
description: After creating reports with embedded requests, you can apply conditional formatting to cells of the workbook.

title: Offline mode for creating and editing requests
description: Offline mode returns placeholder data to speed up the process of creating and editing requests.

title: Report Builder options
description: On the Options panel, you can specify the date settings, latency settings (Current Data), log information, and configure updates.

title: Schedule report requests
description: You can schedule report requests, specify advanced delivery options, specify recipients, and view the schedule history. Advanced delivery options let you configure reports that you want to send at a specific time or in intervals. You can also specify the file format in which to send the report.

title: Schedule a data request
description: You can schedule reports to send according to the time and file format that you define.

title: Scheduled Task Manager
description: Field descriptions for the Scheduled Task Manager.

title: Upload a workbook
description: Upload a Report Builder Excel workbook that you want to share.

title: Download a workbook
description: Download and edit shared workbooks.

title: Lock/unlock workbooks
description: You can protect all requests in a workbook against adding and editing requests by locking the workbook. This enables offline editing of workbooks by pausing all report requests for more efficient editing.

title: Schedule macro-enabled workbooks
description: Adobe Report Builder supports the .xlsm format that lets you schedule macro-enabled workbooks.

title: Publish to Power BI - Overview
description: Use Report Builder with Microsoft Power BI.

title: Limitations and specifications
description: Limitations when using Report Builder and Microsoft Power BI.

title: Manually import data to Power BI
description: If you want to import Analytics data manually through Power BI, follow these instructions.

title: Pull published assets into Power BI Desktop
description: Explains how to pull Report Builder-published assets into Power BI Desktop

title: Best practices
description: Power BI best practices.

title: Troubleshooting Power BI integration
description: Common issues when using Report Builder with Power BI.

title: Adobe Analytics content packs for Power BI
description: Adobe Analytics Content Packs provide pre-built Power BI dashboards and a set of Power BI reports that deliver insights about your site traffic and user dimensions. You can use the dashboard and reports provided, or customize them to highlight the information you care most about. The data will be refreshed automatically once per day.

title: Visual Basic macros in Report Builder
description: Expand the functionality of Excel workbooks and Report Builder using VBA.

title: Troubleshooting and best practices for Report Builder
description: Ways you can optimize report builder delivery, and a list of error messages that could occur occasionally.

title: Report Builder FAQ
description: Frequently asked questions for Report Builder.

title: Activity Map overview
description: Activity Map is an Adobe Analytics application that is designed to rank link activity using visual overlays and provide a dashboard of real-time analytics to monitor audience engagement of your web pages.

title: Enable Activity Map
description: Explains the steps the Analytics Admin needs to complete to enable Activity Map link collection and user download.

title: View sample Activity Map implementation code
description: Example of how the AppMeasurement library and the Activity Map module are combined in the Adobe Analytics implementation code

title: Install Activity Map browser plug-ins
description: The installation process varies depending on which browser you are using.

title: Launch Activity Map
description: Assuming that the correct browser plug-in is installed, you can launch Activity Map directly from your web page.

title: Robust link tracking
description: Activity Map tracks links with a more robust algorithm that

title: Link tracking methodology
description: This section is intended for Adobe Analytics Administrators. It focuses on the new link tracking parameters and how they ensure link uniqueness and consistency across browsers and devices, and improve the handling of link repositioning on a page.

title: Link tracking FAQ
description: Frequently asked questions about link tracking in Activity Map.

title: Differentiate links that reference the same Link ID and region
description: You can differentiate links by customizing the link ID using the s_objectID variable, by customizing the region, and by customizing the AppMeasurement ActivityMap module file.

title: Stop link tracking
description: Steps for stopping link tracking in Activity Map or Legacy ClickMap.

title: Use the tl() method with Activity Map
description: You can use the tl() method to track custom elements and to configure overlay rendering for dynamic content.

title: Standard Mode vs. Live Mode
description: Activity Map provides two basic modes to provide complementary reporting of page activity.

title: Links report
description: The Links report reports on the links that were found on the current page. It does not report on all the links that were collected for that page.

title: Page details
description: The Page Details tab displays the Page Report as a table and the Page Flow Report is shown as a bow tie (butterfly) report.

title: Complete set of metrics
description: Allows you to access a complete set of metrics from Adobe Analytics within the Activity Map toolbar.

title: Real-time (Live) page analytics
description: Real-time page analytics (Live Mode) lets you obtain results with minute granularity in real time.

title: Customer segmentation
description: Lets you apply a multiple-segment filter within Activity Map.

title: Customizable overlays
description: Overlays give you multiple ways of configuring data visualization so that you can easily see and understand the popularity of links on a page.

title: Overlay details
description: Overlay details are shown when you hover on top of a link overlay.

title: Export to CSV file
description: In Standard Mode, export Analytics data from Activity Map to a Comma Separated Values (CSV) file.

title: Supported systems and requirements
description: Activity Map is supported on the following web browsers.

title: Activity Map FAQ
description: Frequently asked questions for setting up, configuring, and employing features in Activity Map.

title: Configure Activity Map settings
description: The Activity Map Setting Panel lets you modify the settings and properties for all types of overlay visualizations.

title: Activity Map user interface
description: The Activity Map UI is comprised of two parts

title: Activity Map reporting in Analytics
description: Describes how to set permissions and which dimensions are available in Analytics.

title: Troubleshooting browser extensions
description: Lists the browser parameters that are not compatible with the use of Activity Map. You should disable these settings.

title: Troubleshoot Activity Map data collection
description: Determine why you cannot see Activity Map data in image requests

title: Knowledge resources
description: Access additional information resources for Adobe Activity Map.

title: Getting started with Reports and Analytics
description: Before using Reports and Analytics, understand these basic login and setup tasks, and how to access account information.

title: Adobe Analytics - key concepts
description: This section contains the key concepts for Adobe Analytics, a brief description of the concept, and a specific documentation link with additional detail on the topic.

title: About Data Collection
description: Learn about how data is collected for Adobe Analytics.

title: Reports Menu
description: An overview of the Reports menu in Reports & Analytics.

title: Report Features
description: An introduction to the features of a report, including the toolbar, calendar, and detail table.

title: Common Terms
description: An introduction to commonly used web analytics terms used in marketing reports.

title: Adobe Analytics for iOS
description: An introduction to the iPad application.

title: Report display settings and navigation
description: Settings that define how all reports appear and information that aps the default menu options to their location in the simplified menu.

title: Report schedule and distribution
description: Information about scheduling, downloading and distributing reports.

title: Reports
description: The dimensions and metrics that Reports & Analytics uses for each report.

title: Run different report types
description: Steps on running the different report types.

title: Customize reports overview
description: After running a report, you can customize the report to view and analyze the data according to your needs. You can filter report data, change how data is presented graphically, change date granularity, and so on.

title: Change report graphs
description: Steps that describe how to customize the graph so that it is most useful for the intended audience.

title: Breakdowns
description: Use breakdowns when you want to know more about how a report item or segment relates to other reports. This is often called "breaking down" a report by another report.

title: Subrelations
description: Full subrelations are enabled on all conversion reports, so you can break down any eVar by another eVar. The Breakdown By menu in the report table matches the standard Analytics reporting menu, keeping selections consistent

title: Filtering Report Data
description: Filters allow you to narrow the report to include or exclude line items that match a filter.

title: Analytics Segmentation
description: Segments are custom subsets of data, or data filtered by rules that you create. Segments are based on hits, visits, and visitors.

title: Bookmark Manager
description: Bookmarks give you access to the reports that you use the most. The bookmarks you create are added to the Experience Cloud and are available in integrated capabilities like data connectors.

title: Current Data
description: The Include Current Data option in Reports & Analytics lets you view the latest Analytics data, often before data is fully processed and finalized. Current data displays most metrics within minutes, providing actionable data for quick decision making.

title: Dashboards and reportlets
description: A dashboard is a collection of thumbnail reports called reportlets. A dashboard is most useful when it contains related reportlets that give you complete overviews of certain aspects of your site, such as finding methods, visitor profiles, and so on.

title: Dashboard Manager
description: Use the Dashboard Manager to copy, share, archive, and schedule dashboards for delivery.

title: Data extract
description: Data extracts let you choose the parameters you will view on both the X- and Y-axes of the report, as well as the item by which the report is filtered.

title: Conversion Funnel
description: Conversion ratios usually measure conversion between the starting, ending, and milestone events or points of a conversion process. After you code the success events onto your site, the report creates the ratios between these different success events and show them in a Conversion Funnel Report.

title: Metrics
description: Metrics are the foundation of reports and help you view and understand data relationships and enable side-by-side comparisons of different data sets about your website. Metrics are quantitative information about visitor activity, such as views, click-throughs, reloads, average time spent, units, orders, revenue, and so on.

title: Targets
description: Targets let you measure your website performance and track progress against target goals. For example, you might want to increase the number of visitors that come from a geographic region, the revenue per order, or the number of hits that come from a specific referrer.

title: Alerts
description: Use alerts in Reports & Analytics.
